page.title: 05LOCH OF SKENE
page.content: The{Loch of Skene}is 300 square acres and is partly man-made.Before 1905 water from the loch was used for making{tweed}and also turned the mill wheel.In 1905, Garlogie tweed mill closed.Then it was used to generate {electricity}but in 1951 the Hydro Board took over. The only kind of fish in the loch is {pike.}About 50 permits are given out each year for fishing in the loch. The Aberdeen{sailing club}use the loch for yachting. There are a lot of stone islands on the loch for{shooting}ducks,geese and rabbits. The Loch of Skene is also{a sight of {special,scientific interest. Over the past years the loch has become very polluted from farming chemicals.
